newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: BMC to assist Singapore-based IT companies.
newsitem.headline: BMC to assist Singapore-based IT companies.

text.p: Computer software developer BMC Software announced on Thursday an agreement with Singapore's National Computer Board (NCB) to assist promising information technology (IT) companies based here.

Under its local industry development programme, BMC will train small and medium enterprises as well as large organisations to become world-class system integrators and solution providers, BMC said in a statement.
In addition, BMC will maintain regular contact with the companies for strategic planning and project management assistance to help them capitalize on specific niche requirements.
"The programme will focus on specific areas of specialisation to upgrade the core capabilities and management skills of our local partners," said Hugh Sutherland, BMC managing director for Asia.
A BMC spokeswoman said four companies have already been identified for the program.
